page.title: 06CLEVELAND BAYS IN GERRICK
page.content:
Grange Farm, Gerrick, is famous as an important centre for the breeding of Cleveland Bay horses. These are riding and carriage horses which originated in this area. They are capable of farm work but are valued as a cross with Thoroughbred to produce middleweight hunters, showjumpers and speedy carriage horses.
They are in the stables of Queen Elizabeth II, The Japanese Emperor, Hirohito and the Pakistan Government.
For further details see 'Sunley's Daughter' by Barry Cockcroft. PUB. J.M. DENT. LONDON.
